2014-12-08.flavor: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

2014-12-08.name: Lost Tallstrider
2014-12-08.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

2014-12-08.name: Mechanical Yeti
2014-12-08.text: Deathrattle: Give each player a Spare Part.
2014-12-08.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

2014-12-08.name: Mini-Mage
2014-12-08.text: Stealth\nSpell Damage +1
2014-12-08.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

2014-12-08.name: Piloted Shredder
2014-12-08.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.
2014-12-08.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

2014-12-08.name: Sabotage
2014-12-08.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
2014-12-08.flavor: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

2014-12-08.name: Screwjank Clunker
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +2/+2.
2014-12-08.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

2014-12-08.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
2014-12-08.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)
2014-12-08.flavor: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

2014-12-08.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
2014-12-08.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
2014-12-08.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

2014-12-08.name: Wee Spellstopper
2014-12-08.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
2014-12-08.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

2014-12-08.name: Antique Healbot
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Restore #8 Health to your hero.
2014-12-08.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

2014-12-08.name: Blingtron 3000
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
2014-12-08.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

2014-12-08.name: Bolvar Fordragon
2014-12-08.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
2014-12-08.flavor: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

2014-12-08.name: Bomb Lobber
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
2014-12-08.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

2014-12-08.name: Cobalt Guardian
2014-12-08.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
2014-12-08.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

2014-12-08.name: Cobra Shot
2014-12-08.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
2014-12-08.flavor: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

2014-12-08.name: Demonheart
2014-12-08.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.
2014-12-08.flavor: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

2014-12-08.name: Druid of the Fang
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
2014-12-08.flavor: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

2014-12-08.name: Fel Reaver
2014-12-08.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.
2014-12-08.flavor: So reaver. Much fel. Wow.

2014-12-08.name: Floating Watcher
2014-12-08.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
2014-12-08.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

2014-12-08.name: Hemet Nesingwary
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Beast.
2014-12-08.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

2014-12-08.name: Junkbot
2014-12-08.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
2014-12-08.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

2014-12-08.name: King of Beasts
2014-12-08.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
2014-12-08.flavor: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.

2014-12-08.name: Madder Bomber
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.
2014-12-08.flavor: Dang, Bomber, calm down.

2014-12-08.name: Mimiron's Head
2014-12-08.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
2014-12-08.flavor: Do not push the big red button!

2014-12-08.name: Ogre Ninja
2014-12-08.text: Stealth\n50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2014-12-08.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

2014-12-08.name: Quartermaster
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2.
2014-12-08.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

2014-12-08.name: Salty Dog
2014-12-08.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

2014-12-08.name: Siege Engine
2014-12-08.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.
2014-12-08.flavor: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!

2014-12-08.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +4 Health.
2014-12-08.flavor: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

2014-12-08.name: Vol'jin
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Swap Health with another minion.
2014-12-08.flavor: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

2014-12-08.name: Anima Golem
2014-12-08.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
2014-12-08.flavor: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

2014-12-08.name: Dark Wispers
2014-12-08.text: Choose One - Summon 5 Wisps; or Give_a minion +5/+5 and Taunt.
2014-12-08.flavor: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

2014-12-08.name: Gazlowe
2014-12-08.text: Whenever you cast a 1-Cost spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
2014-12-08.flavor: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

2014-12-08.name: Iron Juggernaut
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
2014-12-08.flavor: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

2014-12-08.name: Lightbomb
2014-12-08.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
2014-12-08.flavor: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

2014-12-08.name: Mech-Bear-Cat
2014-12-08.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2014-12-08.flavor: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

2014-12-08.name: Mogor the Ogre
2014-12-08.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2014-12-08.flavor: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

2014-12-08.name: Piloted Sky Golem
2014-12-08.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 4-Cost minion.
2014-12-08.flavor: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

2014-12-08.name: Recycle
2014-12-08.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
2014-12-08.flavor: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

2014-12-08.name: Shieldmaiden
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Gain 5 Armor.
2014-12-08.flavor: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

2014-12-08.name: Toshley
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2014-12-08.flavor: Something about power converters.

2014-12-08.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
2014-12-08.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
2014-12-08.flavor: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

2014-12-08.name: Crush
2014-12-08.text: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.
2014-12-08.flavor: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

2014-12-08.name: Dr. Boom
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.
2014-12-08.flavor: MARVEL AT HIS MIGHT!

2014-12-08.name: Flame Leviathan
2014-12-08.text: When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters.
2014-12-08.flavor: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

2014-12-08.name: Gahz'rilla
2014-12-08.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
2014-12-08.flavor: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

2014-12-08.name: Malorne
2014-12-08.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your deck.
2014-12-08.flavor: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

2014-12-08.name: Neptulon
2014-12-08.text: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
2014-12-08.flavor: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

2014-12-08.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
2014-12-08.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
2014-12-08.flavor: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

2014-12-08.name: Foe Reaper 4000
2014-12-08.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever it attacks.
2014-12-08.flavor: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

2014-12-08.name: Force-Tank MAX
2014-12-08.text: Divine Shield
2014-12-08.flavor: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

2014-12-08.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
2014-12-08.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random Legendary minion.
2014-12-08.flavor: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

2014-12-08.name: Mal'Ganis
2014-12-08.text: Your other Demons have +2/+2.\nYour hero is Immune.
2014-12-08.flavor: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

2014-12-08.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
2014-12-08.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
2014-12-08.flavor: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

2014-12-08.name: Tree of Life
2014-12-08.text: Restore all characters to full Health.
2014-12-08.flavor: Healing: It grows on trees!

2014-12-08.name: Clockwork Giant
2014-12-08.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
2014-12-08.flavor: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

2015-04-02.name: Dragon Egg
2015-04-02.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
2015-04-02.flavor: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.

2015-04-02.name: Twilight Whelp
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
2015-04-02.flavor: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.

2015-04-02.name: Gang Up
2015-04-02.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
2015-04-02.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.

2015-04-02.name: Lava Shock
2015-04-02.text: Deal $2 damage.\nUnlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
2015-04-02.flavor: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.

2015-04-02.name: Quick Shot
2015-04-02.text: Deal $3 damage.\nIf your hand is empty, draw a card.
2015-04-02.flavor: Han shot first.

2015-04-02.name: Resurrect
2015-04-02.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
2015-04-02.flavor: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"

2015-04-02.name: Revenge
2015-04-02.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
2015-04-02.flavor: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.

2015-04-02.name: Blackwing Technician
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
2015-04-02.flavor: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!

2015-04-02.name: Demonwrath
2015-04-02.text: [x]Deal $2 damage to all\nminions except Demons.
2015-04-02.flavor: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.

2015-04-02.name: Druid of the Flame
2015-04-02.text: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
2015-04-02.flavor: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.

2015-04-02.name: Flamewaker
2015-04-02.text: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
2015-04-02.flavor: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.

2015-04-02.name: Imp Gang Boss
2015-04-02.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
2015-04-02.flavor: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.

2015-04-02.name: Axe Flinger
2015-04-02.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
2015-04-02.flavor: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

2015-04-02.name: Core Rager
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
2015-04-02.flavor: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.

2015-04-02.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
2015-04-02.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
2015-04-02.flavor: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".

2015-04-02.name: Fireguard Destroyer
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: Gain 1-4 Attack. Overload: (1)
2015-04-02.flavor: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.

2015-04-02.name: Hungry Dragon
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for_your opponent.
2015-04-02.flavor: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.

2015-04-02.name: Blackwing Corruptor
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
2015-04-02.flavor: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

2015-04-02.name: Dark Iron Skulker
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
2015-04-02.flavor: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

2015-04-02.name: Dragon Consort
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
2015-04-02.flavor: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.

2015-04-02.name: Dragon's Breath
2015-04-02.text: Deal $4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2015-04-02.flavor: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.

2015-04-02.name: Grim Patron
2015-04-02.text: After this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
2015-04-02.flavor: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!

2015-04-02.name: Solemn Vigil
2015-04-02.text: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2015-04-02.flavor: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.

2015-04-02.name: Drakonid Crusher
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
2015-04-02.flavor: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humanoid. But, like, why?

2015-04-02.name: Emperor Thaurissan
2015-04-02.text: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
2015-04-02.flavor: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

2015-04-02.name: Volcanic Drake
2015-04-02.text: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2015-04-02.flavor: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.

2015-04-02.name: Rend Blackhand
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
2015-04-02.flavor: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.

2015-04-02.name: Chromaggus
2015-04-02.text: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
2015-04-02.flavor: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.

2015-04-02.name: Majordomo Executus
2015-04-02.text: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros the Firelord.
2015-04-02.flavor: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.

2015-04-02.name: Nefarian
2015-04-02.text: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2015-04-02.flavor: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.

2015-04-02.name: Volcanic Lumberer
2015-04-02.text: Taunt\nCosts (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
2015-04-02.flavor: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!

2015-08-24.name: Arcane Blast
2015-08-24.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.
2015-08-24.flavor: Now with 100% more blast!

2015-08-24.name: Brave Archer
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: This is a "bearly" concealed reference.

2015-08-24.name: Buccaneer
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

2015-08-24.name: Competitive Spirit
2015-08-24.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.

2015-08-24.name: Flash Heal
2015-08-24.text: Restore #5 Health.
2015-08-24.flavor: Flash!  Ahhhhhhh~

2015-08-24.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

2015-08-24.name: Injured Kvaldir
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to this minion.
2015-08-24.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

2015-08-24.name: Living Roots
2015-08-24.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
2015-08-24.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

2015-08-24.name: Lowly Squire
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: But not the lowliest!

2015-08-24.name: Power Word: Glory
2015-08-24.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to\nyour hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

2015-08-24.name: Tournament Attendee
2015-08-24.text: Taunt
2015-08-24.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

2015-08-24.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.
2015-08-24.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

2015-08-24.name: Ancestral Knowledge
2015-08-24.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2)
2015-08-24.flavor: MOMMMMMYYYYYYYYY!!!

2015-08-24.name: Argent Lance
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.
2015-08-24.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

2015-08-24.name: Argent Watchman
2015-08-24.text: Can't attack.\nInspire: Can attack as normal this turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

2015-08-24.name: Bear Trap
2015-08-24.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
2015-08-24.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

2015-08-24.name: Bolster
2015-08-24.text: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.
2015-08-24.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.

2015-08-24.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Health.
2015-08-24.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

2015-08-24.name: Confuse
2015-08-24.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.
2015-08-24.flavor: This minion is really powerful!

2015-08-24.name: Convert
2015-08-24.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: "Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!"

2015-08-24.name: Cutpurse
2015-08-24.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!

2015-08-24.name: Darnassus Aspirant
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.\nDeathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
2015-08-24.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!

2015-08-24.name: Demonfuse
2015-08-24.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
2015-08-24.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

2015-08-24.name: Druid of the Saber
2015-08-24.text: [x]Choose One - Transform\ninto a 2/1 with Charge;\nor a 3/2 with Stealth.
2015-08-24.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

2015-08-24.name: Fallen Hero
2015-08-24.text: Your Hero Power deals 1_extra damage.
2015-08-24.flavor: And he can't get up.

2015-08-24.name: Flame Juggler
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2015-08-24.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"

2015-08-24.name: Garrison Commander
2015-08-24.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

2015-08-24.name: King's Elekk
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.
2015-08-24.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.

2015-08-24.name: Lance Carrier
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

2015-08-24.name: Lock and Load
2015-08-24.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."\n\nThis card pays homage to that special moment.

2015-08-24.name: Sparring Partner
2015-08-24.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Give a\nminion Taunt.
2015-08-24.flavor: Come at me, bro.

2015-08-24.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

2015-08-24.name: Totem Golem
2015-08-24.text: Overload: (1)
2015-08-24.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

2015-08-24.name: Undercity Valiant
2015-08-24.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.
2015-08-24.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

2015-08-24.name: Wrathguard
2015-08-24.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

2015-08-24.name: Wyrmrest Agent
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2015-08-24.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

2015-08-24.name: Argent Horserider
2015-08-24.text: Charge\nDivine Shield
2015-08-24.flavor: His horse's name is Betsy.

2015-08-24.name: Bash
2015-08-24.text: Deal $3 damage.\nGain 3 Armor.
2015-08-24.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

2015-08-24.name: Beneath the Grounds
2015-08-24.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2015-08-24.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

2015-08-24.name: Burgle
2015-08-24.text: Add 2 random cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2015-08-24.flavor: Yoink!

2015-08-24.name: Coliseum Manager
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

2015-08-24.name: Dragonhawk Rider
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Gain Windfury\nthis turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

2015-08-24.name: Dreadscale
2015-08-24.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
2015-08-24.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

2015-08-24.name: Effigy
2015-08-24.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.
2015-08-24.flavor: Burning man, brah.

2015-08-24.name: Elemental Destruction
2015-08-24.text: Deal $4-$5 damage to all minions. Overload: (5)
2015-08-24.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

2015-08-24.name: Eydis Darkbane
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.
2015-08-24.flavor: HATES being called "the wonder twins".

2015-08-24.name: Fencing Coach
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
2015-08-24.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

2015-08-24.name: Fjola Lightbane
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.
2015-08-24.flavor: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".

2015-08-24.name: Healing Wave
2015-08-24.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
2015-08-24.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

2015-08-24.name: Ice Rager
2015-08-24.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

2015-08-24.name: King's Defender
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
2015-08-24.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

2015-08-24.name: Light's Champion
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Silence a Demon.
2015-08-24.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

2015-08-24.name: Master of Ceremonies
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.
2015-08-24.flavor: Goes by "MC ElfyElf".

2015-08-24.name: Mulch
2015-08-24.text: Destroy a minion.\nAdd a random minion to your opponent's hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

2015-08-24.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

2015-08-24.name: Polymorph: Boar
2015-08-24.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.
2015-08-24.flavor: It's always Huffer.

2015-08-24.name: Powershot
2015-08-24.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.
2015-08-24.flavor: pow POW pow

2015-08-24.name: Saboteur
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

2015-08-24.name: Seal of Champions
2015-08-24.text: Give a minion\n+3 Attack and Divine Shield.
2015-08-24.flavor: "Arf! Arf! Arf!" - Seal of Champions

2015-08-24.name: Shadowfiend
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
2015-08-24.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

2015-08-24.name: Shady Dealer
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

2015-08-24.name: Silent Knight
2015-08-24.text: Stealth\nDivine Shield
2015-08-24.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.

2015-08-24.name: Silver Hand Regent
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.
2015-08-24.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

2015-08-24.name: Spellslinger
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

2015-08-24.name: Stablemaster
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

2015-08-24.name: Tuskarr Totemic
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Summon a random basic Totem.
2015-08-24.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

2015-08-24.name: Warhorse Trainer
2015-08-24.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.

2015-08-24.name: Armored Warhorse
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
2015-08-24.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

2015-08-24.name: Astral Communion
2015-08-24.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?

2015-08-24.name: Charged Hammer
2015-08-24.text: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'
2015-08-24.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

2015-08-24.name: Crowd Favorite
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.

2015-08-24.name: Dalaran Aspirant
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.
2015-08-24.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

2015-08-24.name: Draenei Totemcarver
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each friendly Totem.
2015-08-24.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

2015-08-24.name: Dreadsteed
2015-08-24.text: Deathrattle: At the end\n of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.
2015-08-24.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

2015-08-24.name: Evil Heckler
2015-08-24.text: Taunt
2015-08-24.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

2015-08-24.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
2015-08-24.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.
2015-08-24.flavor: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.

2015-08-24.name: Frigid Snobold
2015-08-24.text: Spell Damage +1
2015-08-24.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

2015-08-24.name: Gormok the Impaler
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
2015-08-24.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

2015-08-24.name: Holy Champion
2015-08-24.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

2015-08-24.name: Magnataur Alpha
2015-08-24.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever\nhe attacks.
2015-08-24.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

2015-08-24.name: Maiden of the Lake
2015-08-24.text: Your Hero Power costs (1).
2015-08-24.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.

2015-08-24.name: Murloc Knight
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Summon a random Murloc.
2015-08-24.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

2015-08-24.name: Poisoned Blade
2015-08-24.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
2015-08-24.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

2015-08-24.name: Refreshment Vendor
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Restore #4 Health to each hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

2015-08-24.name: Savage Combatant
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Give your hero\n+2 Attack this turn.
2015-08-24.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

2015-08-24.name: Spawn of Shadows
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

2015-08-24.name: Tournament Medic
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Restore #2 Health to your hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

2015-08-24.name: Twilight Guardian
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
2015-08-24.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

2015-08-24.name: Wildwalker
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.
2015-08-24.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

2015-08-24.name: Clockwork Knight
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.

2015-08-24.name: Flame Lance
2015-08-24.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion.
2015-08-24.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

2015-08-24.name: Kvaldir Raider
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.
2015-08-24.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

2015-08-24.name: Mukla's Champion
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Give your other minions +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

2015-08-24.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

2015-08-24.name: Pit Fighter
2015-08-24.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

2015-08-24.name: Ram Wrangler
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a\nrandom Beast.
2015-08-24.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

2015-08-24.name: Recruiter
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

2015-08-24.name: Shado-Pan Rider
2015-08-24.text: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

2015-08-24.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.
2015-08-24.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

2015-08-24.name: Tuskarr Jouster
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore #7 Health to your hero.
2015-08-24.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

2015-08-24.name: Ball of Spiders
2015-08-24.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners.
2015-08-24.flavor: "THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!" - Everyone

2015-08-24.name: Bolf Ramshield
2015-08-24.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
2015-08-24.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

2015-08-24.name: Coldarra Drake
2015-08-24.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
2015-08-24.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

2015-08-24.name: Dark Bargain
2015-08-24.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
2015-08-24.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

2015-08-24.name: Enter the Coliseum
2015-08-24.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
2015-08-24.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

2015-08-24.name: Grand Crusader
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

2015-08-24.name: Justicar Trueheart
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
2015-08-24.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

2015-08-24.name: Kodorider
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Summon a 3/5 War Kodo.
2015-08-24.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

2015-08-24.name: Master Jouster
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
2015-08-24.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

2015-08-24.name: Mogor's Champion
2015-08-24.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2015-08-24.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

2015-08-24.name: Mysterious Challenger
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
2015-08-24.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

2015-08-24.name: Sea Reaver
2015-08-24.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
2015-08-24.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

2015-08-24.name: Sideshow Spelleater
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Copy your opponent's Hero Power.
2015-08-24.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...

2015-08-24.name: The Mistcaller
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
2015-08-24.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

2015-08-24.name: The Skeleton Knight
2015-08-24.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

2015-08-24.name: Void Crusher
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.
2015-08-24.flavor: We like to call him "Wesley".

2015-08-24.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
2015-08-24.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
2015-08-24.flavor: He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.\n\n*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

2015-08-24.name: Acidmaw
2015-08-24.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.
2015-08-24.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

2015-08-24.name: Captured Jormungar
2015-08-24.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

2015-08-24.name: Chillmaw
2015-08-24.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
2015-08-24.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

2015-08-24.name: Confessor Paletress
2015-08-24.text: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.
2015-08-24.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

2015-08-24.name: Eadric the Pure
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions'\nAttack to 1.
2015-08-24.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

2015-08-24.name: Fearsome Doomguard
2015-08-24.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

2015-08-24.name: Knight of the Wild
2015-08-24.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
2015-08-24.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

2015-08-24.name: Skycap'n Kragg
2015-08-24.text: Charrrrrge\nCosts (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
2015-08-24.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

2015-08-24.name: Rhonin
2015-08-24.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.
2015-08-24.flavor: A masterless shamurai.

2015-08-24.name: Anub'arak
2015-08-24.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
2015-08-24.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

2015-08-24.name: Icehowl
2015-08-24.text: Charge\nCan't attack heroes.
2015-08-24.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

2015-08-24.name: North Sea Kraken
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage.
2015-08-24.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

2015-08-24.name: Aviana
2015-08-24.text: Your minions cost (1).
2015-08-24.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

2015-08-24.name: Frost Giant
2015-08-24.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
2015-08-24.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

2015-08-24.name: Varian Wrynn
2015-08-24.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards.\nPut any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
2015-08-24.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

2015-11-12.name: Murloc Tinyfin
2015-11-12.flavor: High mortality rate, from often being hugged to death.

2015-11-12.name: Cursed Blade
2015-11-12.text: Double all damage dealt to your hero.
2015-11-12.flavor: The Curse is that you have to listen to "MMMBop" on repeat.

2015-11-12.name: Pit Snake
2015-11-12.text: Poisonous
2015-11-12.flavor: It could be worse.  It could be a Snake Pit.

2015-11-12.name: Raven Idol
2015-11-12.text: Choose One -\nDiscover a minion; or Discover a spell.
2015-11-12.flavor: Was petrified when it found out it didn't make the cut for Azerothian Idol.

2015-11-12.name: Reliquary Seeker
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: If you have 6 other minions, gain +4/+4.
2015-11-12.flavor: The Reliquary considers itself the equal of the League of Explorers.  The League of Explorers doesn't.

2015-11-12.name: Sacred Trial
2015-11-12.text: Secret: After your opponent has at least 3 minions and plays another, destroy it.
2015-11-12.flavor: You have chosen poorly.

2015-11-12.name: Sir Finley Mrrgglton
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a new basic Hero Power.
2015-11-12.flavor: In addition to fluent Common, he also speaks fourteen dialects of 'mrgl'.

2015-11-12.name: Tunnel Trogg
2015-11-12.text: Whenever you Overload, gain +1 Attack per locked Mana Crystal.
2015-11-12.flavor: Sure, they're ugly, but they live in tunnels.  You try your beauty routine without natural light.

2015-11-12.name: Curse of Rafaam
2015-11-12.text: Give your opponent a 'Cursed!' card.\nWhile they hold it, they take 2 damage on their turn.
2015-11-12.flavor: This is what happens when Rafaam stubs his toe unexpectedly.

2015-11-12.name: Dark Peddler
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a\n1-Cost card.
2015-11-12.flavor: I'm offering you a bargain here!  This amazing vacuum cleaner for your soul!

2015-11-12.name: Dart Trap
2015-11-12.text: Secret: After an opposing Hero Power is used, deal $5 damage to a random enemy.
2015-11-12.flavor: Five years of tap-dancing lessons are FINALLY going to pay off!

2015-11-12.name: Explorer's Hat
2015-11-12.text: Give a minion +1/+1 and "Deathrattle: Add an Explorer's Hat to your hand."
2015-11-12.flavor: Harrison Jones was disappointed that he didn't get to be part of the League of Explorers, but his hat did.

2015-11-12.name: Huge Toad
2015-11-12.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2015-11-12.flavor: Deals damage when he croaks.

2015-11-12.name: Jeweled Scarab
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a\n3-Cost card.
2015-11-12.flavor: It's amazing what you can do with super glue!

2015-11-12.name: Museum Curator
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a Deathrattle card.
2015-11-12.flavor: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.

2015-11-12.name: Brann Bronzebeard
2015-11-12.text: Your Battlecries trigger twice.
2015-11-12.flavor: Contains 75% more fiber than his brother Magni!

2015-11-12.name: Desert Camel
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Put a 1-Cost minion from each deck into the battlefield.
2015-11-12.flavor: Dang.  This card is sweet.  Almost as sweet as Dessert Camel.

2015-11-12.name: Fierce Monkey
2015-11-12.text: Taunt
2015-11-12.flavor: Fierce monkey.  That funky monkey.

2015-11-12.name: Forgotten Torch
2015-11-12.text: Deal $3 damage. Shuffle a 'Roaring Torch' into your deck that deals 6 damage.
2015-11-12.flavor: Why does a forgotten torch turn into a roaring torch with no provocation?  It's one of life's many mysteries.

2015-11-12.name: Mounted Raptor
2015-11-12.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 1-Cost minion.
2015-11-12.flavor: Clever girl!

2015-11-12.name: Unearthed Raptor
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Gain a copy of its_Deathrattle.
2015-11-12.flavor: Still hunting for the ones who earthed him.

2015-11-12.name: Ancient Shade
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Shuffle an 'Ancient Curse' into your deck that deals 7 damage to you when drawn.
2015-11-12.flavor: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.

2015-11-12.name: Animated Armor
2015-11-12.text: Your hero can only take 1 damage at a time.
2015-11-12.flavor: Try putting it on.  Wait, let me get my camera.

2015-11-12.name: Eerie Statue
2015-11-12.text: Can’t attack unless it’s the only minion on the battlefield.
2015-11-12.flavor: Don't blink!  Don't turn your back, don't look away, and DON'T BLINK.

2015-11-12.name: Elise Starseeker
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Shuffle the 'Map to the Golden Monkey' into your deck.
2015-11-12.flavor: A large part of her job entails not mixing up the Map to the Golden Monkey with the Map to Monkey Island.

2015-11-12.name: Gorillabot A-3
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: If you control another Mech, Discover a Mech.
2015-11-12.flavor: A-1 and A-2 went nuts, when they should have gone bolts.

2015-11-12.name: Jungle Moonkin
2015-11-12.text: Both players have\nSpell Damage +2.
2015-11-12.flavor: The REAL angry chicken!

2015-11-12.name: Keeper of Uldaman
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
2015-11-12.flavor: U da man!  No, U da man!

2015-11-12.name: Rumbling Elemental
2015-11-12.text: After you play a Battlecry minion, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
2015-11-12.flavor: He's a very hungry elemental.

2015-11-12.name: Tomb Pillager
2015-11-12.text: Deathrattle: Add a Coin to your hand.
2015-11-12.flavor: After the guild broke up, he could no longer raid the tombs.

2015-11-12.name: Tomb Spider
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a Beast.
2015-11-12.flavor: Less serious than its cousin, the Grave Spider.

2015-11-12.name: Anubisath Sentinel
2015-11-12.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3/+3.
2015-11-12.flavor: He's actually a 1/1 who picked up the hammer from the last guy.

2015-11-12.name: Djinni of Zephyrs
2015-11-12.text: After you cast a spell on another friendly minion, cast a copy of it on this one.
2015-11-12.flavor: If you want your wish granted, don't rub him the wrong way.

2015-11-12.name: Ethereal Conjurer
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a spell.
2015-11-12.flavor: Despite the name, he's a solid conjurer.

2015-11-12.name: Excavated Evil
2015-11-12.text: Deal $3 damage to all minions.\nShuffle this card into your opponent's deck.
2015-11-12.flavor: MOM! DAD! DON'T TOUCH IT! IT'S EVIL!!!!!!

2015-11-12.name: Summoning Stone
2015-11-12.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random minion of the same Cost.
2015-11-12.flavor: Sometimes it feels like it's always the same slackers that are waiting for a summon.

2015-11-12.name: Entomb
2015-11-12.text: Choose an enemy minion.\nShuffle it into your deck.
2015-11-12.flavor: It's perfectly safe as long as you remember to put in air holes.

2015-11-12.name: Reno Jackson
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, fully heal your hero.
2015-11-12.flavor: Reno is a four-time winner of the 'Best Accessorized Explorer' award.

2015-11-12.name: Wobbling Runts
2015-11-12.text: Deathrattle: Summon three 2/2 Runts.
2015-11-12.flavor: The fourth one fell off in a tragic accident.  They don't talk about it.

2015-11-12.name: Everyfin is Awesome
2015-11-12.text: Give your minions +2/+2.\nCosts (1) less for each Murloc you control.
2015-11-12.flavor: Everyfin is cool when you're part of a murloc team!

2015-11-12.name: Obsidian Destroyer
2015-11-12.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Scarab with Taunt.
2015-11-12.flavor: No obsidian is safe around the Obsidian Destroyer!

2015-11-12.name: Fossilized Devilsaur
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: If you control a Beast, gain Taunt.
2015-11-12.flavor: This was the only job he could get after the dinosaur theme park debacle.

2015-11-12.name: Naga Sea Witch
2015-11-12.text: Your cards cost (5).
2015-11-12.flavor: If she had studied harder, she would have been a C+ witch.

2015-11-12.name: Arch-Thief Rafaam
2015-11-12.text: Battlecry: Discover a powerful Artifact.
2015-11-12.flavor: He's very good at retrieving artifacts.  From other people's museums.

2015-11-12.name: Anyfin Can Happen
2015-11-12.text: Summon 7 Murlocs that died this game.
2015-11-12.flavor: Theme song by Ellie Goldfin and Blagghghlrlrl Harris.

2016-04-26.name: Forbidden Flame
2016-04-26.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.
2016-04-26.flavor: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

2016-04-26.name: Forbidden Healing
2016-04-26.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.
2016-04-26.flavor: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

2016-04-26.name: Forbidden Ritual
2016-04-26.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.
2016-04-26.flavor: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

2016-04-26.name: Forbidden Shaping
2016-04-26.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.
2016-04-26.flavor: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

2016-04-26.name: Bladed Cultist
2016-04-26.text: Combo: Gain +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

2016-04-26.name: Blood To Ichor
2016-04-26.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.
2016-04-26.flavor: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

2016-04-26.name: Divine Strength
2016-04-26.text: Give a minion +1/+2.
2016-04-26.flavor: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

2016-04-26.name: Evolve
2016-04-26.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.
2016-04-26.flavor: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

2016-04-26.name: Fiery Bat
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2016-04-26.flavor: He'll always be our first.

2016-04-26.name: Forbidden Ancient
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each Mana spent.
2016-04-26.flavor: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.

2016-04-26.name: Journey Below
2016-04-26.text: Discover a Deathrattle card.
2016-04-26.flavor: Don't stop believing there's something below.

2016-04-26.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Equip a 1/3 Rusty Hook.
2016-04-26.flavor: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

2016-04-26.name: On the Hunt
2016-04-26.text: Deal $1 damage.\nSummon a 1/1 Mastiff.
2016-04-26.flavor: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

2016-04-26.name: Possessed Villager
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Shadowbeast.
2016-04-26.flavor: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

2016-04-26.name: Primal Fusion
2016-04-26.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.
2016-04-26.flavor: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

2016-04-26.name: Selfless Hero
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.
2016-04-26.flavor: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

2016-04-26.name: Shifter Zerus
2016-04-26.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.
2016-04-26.flavor: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

2016-04-26.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
2016-04-26.flavor: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

2016-04-26.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a 1/1 Murloc.'
2016-04-26.flavor: Nobody expects the Vilefin Inquisition!

2016-04-26.name: Zealous Initiate
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.

2016-04-26.name: A Light in the Darkness
2016-04-26.text: Discover a minion.\nGive it +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark?  If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

2016-04-26.name: Beckoner of Evil
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
2016-04-26.flavor: Here, Evil!  C'mon boy!

2016-04-26.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Ooze with Taunt.
2016-04-26.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

2016-04-26.name: Cult Sorcerer
2016-04-26.text: [x]Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
2016-04-26.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

2016-04-26.name: Darkshire Librarian
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry:\nDiscard a random card. Deathrattle:\nDraw a card.
2016-04-26.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

2016-04-26.name: Duskboar
2016-04-26.flavor: Often excluded from dinner parties.  To be fair, he is very boaring.

2016-04-26.name: Embrace the Shadow
2016-04-26.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.
2016-04-26.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

2016-04-26.name: Eternal Sentinel
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
2016-04-26.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.

2016-04-26.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
2016-04-26.text: Give a minion +2/+2.\nIf it's a Beast, draw\na card.
2016-04-26.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

2016-04-26.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
2016-04-26.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
2016-04-26.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

2016-04-26.name: Renounce Darkness
2016-04-26.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.
2016-04-26.flavor: SEE YA DARKNESS!

2016-04-26.name: Shatter
2016-04-26.text: Destroy a Frozen minion.
2016-04-26.flavor: What's cooler than being cool?

2016-04-26.name: Stormcrack
2016-04-26.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)
2016-04-26.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

2016-04-26.name: Twilight Geomancer
2016-04-26.text: [x]Taunt\nBattlecry: Give your C'Thun\nTaunt (wherever it is).
2016-04-26.flavor: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

2016-04-26.name: Twisted Worgen
2016-04-26.text: Stealth
2016-04-26.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

2016-04-26.name: Undercity Huckster
2016-04-26.text: Deathrattle: Add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
2016-04-26.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

2016-04-26.name: Addled Grizzly
2016-04-26.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

2016-04-26.name: Am'gam Rager
2016-04-26.flavor: peerc rewop

2016-04-26.name: Blood Warriors
2016-04-26.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
2016-04-26.flavor: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

2016-04-26.name: Bloodsail Cultist
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

2016-04-26.name: Carrion Grub
2016-04-26.flavor: Carrion, my wayward grub.

2016-04-26.name: Darkshire Councilman
2016-04-26.text: [x]After you summon a minion,\n gain +1 Attack.
2016-04-26.flavor: Democracy in action!

2016-04-26.name: Disciple of C'Thun
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
2016-04-26.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

2016-04-26.name: Feral Rage
2016-04-26.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
2016-04-26.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

2016-04-26.name: Forlorn Stalker
2016-04-26.text: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.
2016-04-26.flavor: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

2016-04-26.name: Infest
2016-04-26.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
2016-04-26.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

2016-04-26.name: Rallying Blade
